qas.question: When did Lord North take office?
When did Lord North leave office?
Which victories against the Americans did the British celebrate?
How did Burke feel about the British celebrating victories against the Americans?
When was the American Declaration of Independence issued?
How did Lord North feel about the British celebrations?
What states were the Americans victorious over Britain in?
What did Burke claim authoritarianism was being changed by?

context: The administration of Lord North (<a0_0><b5_0>1770<b5_0/><a0_0/>–<a1_0>1782<a1_0/>) tried to defeat the colonist rebellion by military force. British and American forces clashed in 1775 and, in <a4_0>1776<a4_0/>, came the <b9_0>American Declaration of Independence<b9_0/>. Burke was <a3_0><b6_0>appalled<b6_0/><a3_0/> by celebrations in Britain of the defeat of the Americans at <a2_0><b7_0>New York and Pennsylvania<b7_0/><a2_0/>. He claimed the <b8_0>English national character<b8_0/> was being changed by this authoritarianism. Burke wrote: "As to the good people of England, they seem to partake every day more and more of the Character of that administration which they have been induced to tolerate. I am satisfied, that within a few years there has been a great Change in the National Character. We seem no longer that eager, inquisitive, jealous, fiery people, which we have been formerly".
